intro: Angkalanthus paucifolius, commonly known as the sparse-leaved angkalanthus, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many species of shrubs and herbs. The plant is characterized by its small, narrow leaves and clusters of small, white or pale yellow flowers. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest undergrowth. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
